Definition: A calculated average of two or more blood pressure readings in a specified time period or according to a specified algorithm or protocol. The average blood pressure has a systolic and a diastolic component.
A profile of the Device resource used specifically for blood pressure devices and includes an extension for blood pressure cuff size.
Blood Pressure Panel; a grouping of systolic, diastolic, and mean arterial blood pressure components.
The measurement in centimeters or inches from the top of the head to bottom of the heel, taken while lying down.
A numerical index based on an individual’s weight in kilograms divided by the square of their height in meters.
The measured mass of an individual’s body.
The number of heart beats in a minute.
The measurement in centimeters or feet and inches from the top of the head to the heel, usually while standing.

Profile: Oxygen Saturation in Arterial blood, method not specified
Definition: A measurement of the percentage to which oxygen is bound to hemoglobin in arterial blood.

Profile: Oxygen Saturation in Arterial Blood by Pulse Oximetry
Definition: A measurement of the percentage to which oxygen is bound to hemoglobin in arterial blood via pulse oximetry.
The measured number of breaths taken in a minute.
An average blood pressure (systolic and diastolic) over a twenty four hour period.

A vital signs panel as defined by Logica Health. It includes Oxygen Saturation via Pulse Oximetry, Oxygen Saturation in Arterial blood, body height, body length, body weight, body temperature, blood pressure panel, heart rate, respiratory rate, head-occcipital/frontal circumference, oxygen saturation via pulse oximetry, and body mass index.
Situations that may affect the measurement or assessment.
The size of pressure cuff used to measure blood pressure.
The exercise state associated with the measurement.
The system or defined process used in a measurement.
The location or setting the subject was in when the measurement was obtained. For example, home, clinic, hospital. etc.
The kind of sensor used to measure the oxygen saturation.
The state of wakefulness during the measurement.
